Reviews.Title: “AA”
Reviews.Author: A A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel it does not worth the money. there are lots of noise and you can not get a decent night sleep there is not even a shampoo or soap in the bath the tovels look dirty the lift was a pain and not working most of the time

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adnan D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 nights. Excellent location, Just +- 15 minutes by tram from Both Central and Amstel stations. Close by many restaurants and bar's. Museum and Garden 5 minutes walk. The guy(Nepali) at reception was so nice and friendly and he guided us to many good things we enjoyed in Amsterdam. I didn't tasted the breakfast, Rooms are little small but bed was good. Shower is OK. Overall Positive :)

Reviews.Title: “hotel is covered with fleas”
Reviews.Author: Emy C
Reviews.Content: Thanks to a 2 night stay in this hotel, particularly room 254 I came home covered in flea bites. After a visit to the doctor I warned the hotel but they were not interested in my experiences. For breakfast I saw a dog walking around in the kitchen from a staff member. Breakfast was probably also very hygienic

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in lovely location”
Reviews.Author: lynne s
Reviews.Content: we had a three night stay at this hotel with breakfast. there are quite a few positives and some ares which could be improved but not enough to put us off from staying there again. The hotel was situated in a lovely quiet street right next to a gorgeous park. With tram links just round the corner that take you straight to amsterdam city centre we found this better than staying too close. Tram fares are also relatively cheap. There was quite a variety on offer for breakfast and you can eat as much as you like. Hotel staff were polite and helpful. Room was very clean and had been described as a 'small' double room so we were quite impressed by its size. The windows had net curtains as well as blackout curtains. The room was a little cold although the heating was on however we were quite happy with that. The hotel also runs a shuttle service straight to the airport which we found very handy as our flight was early in the morning. The shower area was clean with plenty of towels and shower wash. The shower was temperamental with the temperature and it took a while to gage it. The lock on the room door looked as though it had recently been broken and hadn't been repaired very well however the door still appeared to lock properly but left us a little nervous as to the security of the room. We did report this however it had not been repaired by the time we left to go home. Breakfast time was from 7 - 10.30 however as our flight was so early the hotel staff allowed us to have our breakfast at 6.30 am. There was the usual tv (satellite) hair dryer and coffee facilities however there was no iron so would recommend taking a travel iron if staying at this hotel. All in all we had a pleasant stay and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Firemunchkin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here for a relaxing break away. We loved Amsterdam but would not stay at this hotel again. The room itself was a decent sized double and clean on the surface but it was clear most of the furniture/fittings needed a good dusting. The bed linen was too big for the duvet/pillows and none of the furniture matched properly, 2 of the chairs actually had large holes and tears in the leather. The bed was very comfortable though, and we had a beautiful view out over the Vondelpark with large floor to ceiling windows - but it's a shame they steamed up so easily in the morning, and it would have been nice if they'd remembered to put up the white curtain for privacy (it was hanging on a hanger by the door) because the back of the hotel also faces apartments. There wasn't a fridge but it was so cold outside we just put what we wanted on the window sill outside as the windows opened - very handy for a diet coke! We only had 1 pillow each, and no spares or blankets. No info leaflets or do not disturb notice, but the TV was good and we got BBC1 and ITV1. The bathroom was small but again the same level of cleanliness (the tissue box looked like it hadn't been cleaned in months). The shower itself was a small cubicle and a huge shower head which meant having very little room to move without getting wet. Yes, it's a shower and you would want that - but not if you don't want to wash your hair every day which I was annoyingly forced to do. It really wasn't a pleasant experience showering, the water wasn't very powerful, the streams thin and sparse which made it difficult to rinse my hair properly. It was equally impossible to lather my body properly with the spray of the water reaching the entirety of the cubicle, and the temperature was impossible to get right - it would just go really hot without even touching the controls. Odd also was the toilet roll holder being situated so that you couldn't properly sit on the loo without scratching yourself on it. Body wash and hand wash were provided, but no other hotel minis, and the loo roll itself was really rough. The wall-attached hairdryer was useless (it was freezing outside and I had just been forced to wash my hair), the towels were small and there wasn't a heated towel rail or shower mat for the floor. Unfortunately, we also had the noisiest creaking floor outside our room and we could hear everything and everyone going past, there was very little sound proofing and we were woken up several times during the night with passing guests. The lift didn't work from the ground floor (you had to go down to the basement to call it) and there appeared to be no attempts to have it fixed. The wi-fi was â‚¬8 a day I think, but there was a free to use computer in the lobby which was very very handy. The breakfast was disappointing too - no cooked breakfast except scrambled eggs that were a bit grey or hard boiled eggs and some DIY toast. There was a large array of processed hams and cheeses, packet croissants/pastries, granola/corn flakes, yoghurt, tinned fruit salad and concentrated fruit juice - there's a lot there but the quality was not something I'd expect to pay â‚¬10 for. Particularly of note was the large sign stating that no food could be taken from the breakfast room. What if I want to finish my breakfast upstairs whilst showering? I've paid for it I should be able to do what I like with it thanks. The only positive thing I'd say was that they had rooibus tea which is something I very rarely find in hotels. However, the hotel staff were helpful and courteous, and the location was very good - very close to good tram links and on a lovely quiet street close to the park. As isolated complaints, the above isn't so bad, but collectively they made our stay at this hotel a little more stressful than relaxing. Shame really.

Reviews.Title: “new year in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ferdieyorkshire
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean and the heating worked very well, staff were helpful and it was situated next to a wonderfull park and close to the fashion centre and museums. Only fault was the noise from guest in the corridors.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good News”
Reviews.Author: liz f
Reviews.Content: My son has just got home this evening and is absolutely covered in bed bug bites. I would not recommend this hotel. Sorry. I am writing to the hotel and advising them, but this should never have happened. Disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: Chloe714
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a girls trip to Amsterdam. Taking into account the negative reviews, we weren't expecting a great experience, but for a budget break we didn't want to break the bank. However, I was very pleasantly surprised and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The hotel is very close to the museum district, and easily accessible from Schipol (the airport). We took a train to the central station, and then picked up a tram (very speedy and affordable way to travel). When we first arrived we ended up walking further than necessary because we didn't use the right tram stop, but it allowed us to see that the hotel is one block over from one of the most prestigious streets in Amsterdam - with many shops that we couldn't afford to go in! The hotel is walking distance to museums such as the Van Gogh, and you can get to Leidesplein (lots of bars and restaurants) in about 5 minutes via the park. On arrival, we were too early to check in but they were happy to store our bags for us and the lady on reception gave us a map and directions to a local market, the Albert Kuyp market, which gave us a throroughly enjoyable afternoon before we returned to check in. Our triple room was spacious (actually containing four single beds) had a clean bathroom, and plenty of towels, which were replenished daily. We had a desk/dressing table, tv, bedside tables and a wardrobe. Throughout our stay the staff were helpful and willing to assist us with directions and information to get to various tourist attractions. Breakfast was a variety of fruit juices, cereal, bread, pastry, meats and cheeses. I admit I'm not the most picky traveller - I don't need state of the art technology or brand new furniture, I just need cleanliness, space and helpful staff. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gone_ChopinBach_Soon
Reviews.Content: My arms, shoulders, back and feet are covered with bed bug bites--red welts that are painful and itchy. We saw bugs on one of the beds, but, having gotten in late, we didn't raise the alarm with hotel staff. I slept in a narrow bed with one of my daughters, leaving the infested bed empty. We left early in the morning, and later that day, we discovered that I had been bitten--excessively. I can say nothing good about a hotel that has such a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdamage”
Reviews.Author: MCRAD16
Reviews.Content: We've just spent a week at this hotel having been advised this from a friend due to its location. Our first night was spent in a small double -far too small for us. On approaching front desk the next morning, they were happy to change us to room which was almost double the size, at no extra cost. Breakfast was included in our costing and it was quite a decent fare. We believe that if you greet and talk to the staff with respect, they'll do everything to help you. The main museums in Amsterdam were very close while the tram was very close too. The very upmarket shopping area is in the same street - dream while you walk the street. Overall, the hotel was satisfactory in a great location for us.

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality ,never again ... :-(”
Reviews.Author: Starlight56
Reviews.Content: We booked via Superbreak..and got this bottom of the barrel hotel. We were dropped off near the central station in Amsterdam, and never realised how far away our hotel was.We finally arrived at reception and were gutted to see the below average hotel reception area ,and told that check in was only at 2pm.We were told we could leave our cases in the breakfast area.(right next to the dirty laundry area :( and could return at 2pm to check in.We came back at 2pm and were given our room cards,and proceeded to the 2nd floor.The general area ,passages ect badly needed upgrading and seemed to be very worn out :( and rather depressing. Our room had the basics , including an en suite (silicone all mouldy and looked dirty in the shower ,large crack in the wall tiles and broken door handle ) The double bed was fine,but bedding didnt look good, also curtains all creased and sad looking.Not enough sugar for tea and coffee,no milk at all :( 2 chairs in the room, sadly plastic covers all ripped on the edges. Continental breakfast was reasonable but the dirty laundry area ,a bit off putting right next to the scrambled eggs container!!! I would never recommend this hotel to anyone,as we did not enjoy our stay at all. I hope the management read these reviews and get this hotel renovated and redecorated.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre place for a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Quass
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in 2 star hotels that are nicer. Do not accept a room below the lobby. It is like sleeping in a basement or cave. There is very little light or ventilation. The evening hotel staff deals with you like you are at a swap-meet, by negotitating with you. I am pretty easy going and dont have a problem with 2 star hotels, but this one should not be classified as a 3 star. It's a short walk to the Leidsplein area and Vondel park. The breakfast is average and I suggest you dine elsewhere. On a positive note the bathroom is fairly large.

Reviews.Title: “good location for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: jody_lee1
Reviews.Content: we booked a triple room for 3 nights including breakfast. The receptionist was very nice and helpful and let us drop our bags off as we were early so that we could go off exploring before check in. Really good location for liedsplein, vondelpark and tram stop close by. The hotel itself needs a bit of love and attention, but overall was a pleasent stay. The breakfast buffet was really good included fresh breads, croissants, juices, cereals,yoghurt and scrambled eggs aswell as the usual continental meats/cheeses. The room was a good size, clean beds - the bathroom was rather tatty looking, but clean and the shower was very powerful with hot water the entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rather basic, but can work if you're not picky.”
Reviews.Author: dimrub
Reviews.Content: The location is nice: adjacent to a large park, very close to the Rijksmuseum and to the Van Gogh museum, 10 minutes ride to the center of the city on a tram going nearby. The location is mostly qiuet, though there was some loud partying under our window on the second night of our stay. The parking on the street costs 4 euros per hour (for hours 9-24), or 36 euros for the whole day. There is also an option to leave the car on a parking lot somewhere for 8 euros per day, and come back on a tram (ask at the reception for details). There is a rather horrid smell in the hallways (probably has something to do with a frequently used ashtray located near the elevator, just 2 meters from our room's door). The room is rather spartan with the 4 beds being placed in a row, but rather clean. The bathroom is the worse part though: the door has no lock, the stream of water in the shower is very weak, and if you flush the toilet, during the next 5 minutes the water in the shower is boiling hot. The breakfast is a rather basic affair, but cleanly served. All in all, it's passable, unless you're extra sensitive to the cigarette smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a short break stay”
Reviews.Author: margery1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Hotel was clean, comfortable and offers a substantial breakfast. Staff, we found, were friendly, efficient and helpful. OK, it could probably do with a thorough makeover, but what do you want? We required a bed to sleep in after a days sight-seeing at a reasonable price, and that's what we got. Would recommend for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Quiglies
Reviews.Content: The Reception Desk staff and the Breakfast Restaurant staff, gave us good service. The servicing of our bedroom was good as far as bedlinen and towels were concerned, but the room could have benefited from a "deep clean". The hotel can arrange transport to and from the airport at a more reasonable cost than public transport. Our room was not large, and we choose to stay on the top floor to have the view over the park and the city - but when we left the lift and continued to our room, the last staircase was steep and a bit difficult to manuver suit cases. We felt the location was good as it gave us immediate access to the large park. Trams were available nearby, but we enjoyed walking the city to enjoy the atmosphere. Designer clothing retail shops were also nearby, and some restaurants were also nearby. My husband and I liked being close enough to tourist attractions and restaurants, but with the quietness of a hotel in a cul de sac and beside a large park with cafes. As a couple in the "over 65 year old" bracket - it would have helped if we had been escorted to our room and had our cases carried for us.

Reviews.Title: “promising start went downhill”
Reviews.Author: kebabus
Reviews.Content: we got off the tram at the museum and walked down hooftstraat and thought we were very lucky to have a hotel on the richest street with all the designer stores including tiffanys etc ,only to be disapointed when we crossed the road to our hotel, and even more dissapointed when we got to our room, it was very small with furniture that was too big for it, the kettle wouldnt work in the socket it was supposed to, the hotel had run out of milk !,the shower door fell off when i was in there,the towels had big holes in,the windows had no safety catches on them and opened straight out,we were on the 3rd floor!allin allnot a good experiance,would not stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “don't leave anything you care about in your room!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsSmith15
Reviews.Content: My young daughter recently stayed at the City Garden Hotel as part of a school trip. She had something taken from her room. When I spoke to the hotel - they were rude, unhelpful. The woman on reception acknowledged that staff had probably taken it but stated she felt no responsibility! Very disappointing. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: robncarz
Reviews.Content: we went to amsterdam to see the sights and not stay in the room all day. Room was nice size and clean. Comfy bed. Two tram services into town the 5 and 2. We walked everywhere. No probs with our stay. Would recomend. Rob n carz from london

Reviews.Title: “Maybe if you like FREEZING COLD showers...”
Reviews.Author: iamtechnicolor
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here with my boyfriend. The room was moderately clean until I looked at the curtains which were stained and looked to have mold on them. The size of the room was tiny which isn't a huge deal as we aren't too picky... the WORST part... I booked a double bed, which I confirmed when I checked in... and what we got was two twin beds pushed together. Did not foster the romantic mood at all. The walls are paper thin and we could hear people late into the night and early into the morning. Also, by 9:30 the hotel was out of hot water. I have never been to a hotel and not been able to have a hot shower... That was quite the wake up call. If you are on an extreme budget and can get this for pennies it may be worth it, but it wasn't worth the Â£70 we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip and wonderful treatment at Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buddy1949123
Reviews.Content: We travelled in party of 3persons.On arrival at Hotel we were offered a choice of 2 rooms.Amazing hospitality shown by Reception staff,especially Mr Mursat. Hotel at end of a Cul-de-sac with entrance to Vondelpark thru which you can walk to Entertainment Area with Bars and Restaurants. It is wonderful to stay in a hotel with constant hot water and clean towels plus a Breakfast to satisfy all tastes. Would recommend to anyone who wishes to stay in very nice area with easy access to all Attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JetteL
Reviews.Content: It was nice stay there, good breacfast. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, rubbish hotel in a nice area of Amsterdam...”
Reviews.Author: AmayahA
Reviews.Content: RUBBISH HOTEL! Chairs are chewed up and burns all over the carpet. No hallway or sofas to sit on downstairs. The corridors stink and the toilet wasn't very clean, found a used shaving razor on the floor!!! Some receptionists don't even make eye contact and rude when you ask them any basic question. Walls are paper thin and is sooo noisy ALL the time. Cleaner just barges in even if you have a 'no disturb' sign!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel - Bad reviews undeserved from my experience.”
Reviews.Author: HopscotchJunkie
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here, and I have to say I didn't experience anything that others seem to be complaining about. I booked a single room in advance, but arrived late (getting towards midnight) and was given a double as the singles had all been taken.The room was fine; perfect size for me, but I can see why people could think it on the small size if there were two people in here with suitcases. Certainly not uncomfortably small (and no sign of these alleged rats!). Breakfast was plentiful; buffet-style selection of rolls, toast, cheese, meats, eggs, cereals, yoghurt, etc. A lot better than I expected for the price, and better than I've had in pricier hotels. Good set-up for the day. The hotel is in a nice location right next to the Vondelpark on a shopping street well away from the noise and Brits-on-tour idiocy of the centre. Although it looks a fair distance from the station/centre on the map, it only took me about 35 minutes to walk between the two; this would probably have been reduced to minutes if I'd bothered to try and work out the tram network but I prefer walking so didn't. There's not much in the way of nightlife directly around the hotel, but it's only a 10-15 minute walk either South-east to De Pijp (brown cafes and quiet local coffeeshops like Katsu or Club Media), North-east to Leidseplein (touristy bars) or North to the edge of Jordaan (more brown cafes and quieter coffeeshops like La Tertulie and (my favourite) 1e Hulp). In all, great hotel for solo travellers/couples wanting a quiet city break; I'd be happy to stay here again, and in all honesty I probably will. Probably not recommended for larger groups after the Amsterdam RLD nightlife 'experience', but that's really no great loss ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy and clean rooms, not deserving of bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: rose_7275
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner at the Hotel City Garden for 3 nights this october, and was dubious about the trip because of all the bad reviews on here. However the bed reviews seem to be mostly from larger groups, so i wasnt too concerned as a small room is not a problem for two small people! The best things about the hotel were that: - Staff at desk were efficient, booked us a taxi back to the airport and there was always someone there, even at 5am. They also had information on restaurants and transport nearby, and spoke above average English. - Breakfast was lovely, including french toast, rolls, ham and cheese, juices and scrambled egg - Rooms were cleaned daily and beds were made, also the small kettle and teacups in the room were washed for you daily, along with providing new teabags, sugar etc. - Vending machine in the lobby for midnight drinks and snacks! - Brilliant location near beautiful park, 2 minute walk to cashpoint and tram stops, and 5 minutes to hard rock cafe and wagamamas, then about 10-15 mins to Liedesplein centre. Also very close to many designer shops :) The only complaints i would have are that: - Wardrobes were fine size for 3-4 night stay, but with only 4 hangers and one drawer, there wouldnt be enough space for even a week's clothes. Also the safe provided did not lock, defeating the point of it. - The door was very hard to open, but the windows opened fully, meaning there was no barrier to stop you falling out into the street! We were on the second floor, therefore i was glad we did not have children!! Other than these minor set-backs, i would reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and NOT deserving of the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: jjhousen
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for me, my spouse, my teenage son and teenage twin nephews. On arrival, the front office person was very efficient. I think it is the efficiency which is mistaken for rudeness. My son and nephews were given a triple room downstairs immediately below the kitchen. Because of the early morning noise which woke them up frequently, we ask for a switch and were courteously provided one. I was extremely pleased with the service, the wi-fi capability, the bedding, and the assistance of the front desk. I genuinely, honestly felt I received value for money and would definitely stay at this location again. It was close to three of the main trams' stops that I needed and the boys absolutely loved it once the room was changed. I felt inclined to write this review as I saw so many 'bad' reviews which in my view is totally unjustifiable.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE MICE THREAT AND ALSO BED BUGS!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: caz5062
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel City Garden in October 2010 and booked 2 triple rooms, on arrival we asked could we check in early as our flight to Amsterdam was early, this was not possible so they said they could store our luggage and that we could check in at 2pm. When we arrived back to our hotel at 2pm we were freaked by a rentokill man who was checking the hotel over for mice, as you can imagine now we are not happy girls, we confronted the man on reception who tells us the problem in under control and not to worry, but seriously you cannot help but worry when you have a rentokill man walking around the hotel in front of customers. We went to our rooms in disgust and they looked ok now to be fair the man showd us how to use shower etc, within 2 minutes of him leaving the room he knocked on the door to see if he could check something and we agreed nervously, he had the nerve to bring a rentokill man into our bedroom and check a mouse trap behind the bed. The two men now were trying to reasure us that there was no mice, on our entire visit we were freaked out by this we never seen a mouse in the hotel but come on you dont bring a rentokill man into your room to check the trap while you have paying guests sitting there watching you!!! Bad idea!!! Hairdyer was broken and light didnt work in our room, window sill was all cracked and broken and one window was tied with wire because it was also broken so overall i would not recommend this hotel to anyone. When you pay the price that we paid the least you expect is a room thats clean and not looking around the room your hole visit for mice. Our bathroom door wouldnt lock either. We also seen reviews after we had booked this hotel about bed bugs but thank god we didnt come across any of these either. But over all i would not recommend this hotel fir anyone, you can stay somewhere alot better for a little bit more. what you'd think you'd save by staying in this hotel you'd spend on taxis and trams going to Leidsepleain and Red Light District.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandSjs
Reviews.Content: The rooms were not good, we had a broken shower door ,4 beds in the room when it was not a room for 4 people no space to move, TV did not work. Friends who were staying in another room had to move due to dirt/damp/broken shower. I did see some nice rooms in the corridor when the maid was in cleaning so it is possible to get a better room. The corridors were grubby carpets very stained. No bar as was pictured on the website apparently they photos on line are old. Breakfast was very good surprisongly and the staff were very friendly, the hotel is in a good location for the galleries and the park however considering the cost was 200 euros a night I am sure you would find something better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: KY_Chan_54
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed there for a night at the end of May. Although quite far (10-15 mins by tram) from the city centre, it was just next to the very nice Vondel Park and close to restaurants, shops and the museums. The reception area is basic but the service was friendly and good. Although a bit apprehensive reading previous reviews, I found the twin room though smallish to be comfortable, clean, quiet and self-contained. The breakfast was surprisingly good with food that is not normally part of a continental breakfast. I understand that Amsterdam is an expensive city so this hotel is really good value for the money you pay. I would stay there again and recommend to others who want value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lumpy pillows and noisy neighbours”
Reviews.Author: Siriolhj
Reviews.Content: More of a hostel than a hotel, this caters very much for the youth, budget market. The walls and ceilings are thin so don't expect to sleep through others getting in at 3.30am... The window of our room also failed to shut - not so much of an issue in July (though we did have a problem with mosquitoes in the night) - but you'd hope they'd fix it before the weather deteriorates. More positively, the location is great and the reception staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel to stay for lower budget”
Reviews.Author: punamiyap
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel. 15 minutes Away from city center by bus. Competitive price. Small but modern rooms. Small breakfast. But Good and cooperative staff for tourist friendly.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst Hotels”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravel711
Reviews.Content: First off, the people that worked at reception were quite rude. We had booked a quad room even though there were only going to be three people in the room, and they said they would only give us one key. For a four person room, one key is not even in the slightest bit efficient. Next, the room was small, smelled like old urine, and had mold growing in the bathroom. The first night we were there it was very loud, and since we were in the front of the hotel when people went out to smoke the cigarette smoke came into our room. The maid didnt clean the second day we were there, so we were without clean towels. Overall, one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at. Dont know how they got a 3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Not one complaint, Nice hotel, Good location, Great for seeing Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ANNE1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel recently and I have to say I did not come across any mice!! Some of the pictures on the reviews must be very old because I stayed in a small double room and friends stayed in the larger room and the bathroom/bedroom in both rooms were in great condition and very clean!!! Now the small double did have a smaller bathroom/bedroom compared to the larger rooms but they are great if you dont want to spend the extra money, still adequate enough!!! Flat screen t.v in both rooms, hairdryer, tea/coffee facilties, phone, alarm clock, what more do you want.!!! Location is great for seeing Amsterdam, Leidelsplein is not even a 10 minute walk from the hotel where the nightlife is and about a 3 minute walk to the nearest tram stop which brings you to all the main stops, ie Anne Franks, Dam square, right up to central station, which can all be reached by foot if you want. Every thing is in walking distance but the tram is also an option if you want to give urself a break, I find Amsterdam to be quiet small so if you like walking you will never have a problem getting anywhere by foot!! Really can't fault it, good part of Amsterdam, expensive street of amsterdam, Tiffany's, Gucci, Louis Vuitton, no noise from the streets at night!! The lady and the man both on the reception during my stay I found to be very nice and helpfull. Would def recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel. Good location by a park and short walk to most things.”
Reviews.Author: flashbackunlimited
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stopped in Amsterdam for 3 days on a layover to India. Loved amsterdam, even in January. The hotel is half a block from a major park and only a few blocks from canals, amsterdam hard rock, shops and musems. The rooms are small but they all are there. It was very clean and effeciently laid out. It came with a full buffet breakfast which was very good. Nothing amazing but very good. We got there on a weekend and paid $90 us which is high but about average from what we saw in the internet. The rate dropped to 50 during the week. Staff were great and very helpful. Free internet too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, will be going back!”
Reviews.Author: Shelly66
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in Jan 2010, when we arrived the staff on reception were a little rude, but then they upgraded our room for us free of charge as we went out of season. The room was comfortable, clean and modern, and we had no complaints at all. The room was cleaned every day. If you are sharing with someone, you both cant have a shower in the morning as one shower will use the hot water supply. The only bad points i can think of are the staff are a little dismissive and rude, and the breakfast wasnt great. It was cereal, sandwhich meat, bread and croissants. There was scrambled egg but it was very greasy. The hotel is a great place to stay if you are doing upmarket shopping, as it's on the same street as Prada, Gucci and a lot of shops. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff made for very good value”
Reviews.Author: FoxburrNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights while waiting for our flight out of Schiphol. There was a lift to the second floor (the one above the ground floor). The room we were given was a reasonable size. It had a large bed, a writing table and a chair, and an easy chair. We found the suitcase stands were adequate, allowing us to use what we wanted without unpacking everything. Yhe lights were bright enough to read by. Our room overlooked the street (oh no!) and the HOTEL sign was outside our window (oh no!). In fact, neither caused us the least concern. The curtains darkened the room, and there was no street noise. The bathroom was small but adequate, It was old fashioned but clean. However, toilet bags had to go on the floor as there was no shelf or vanity top. On the other hand, the shower was hot and powerful. Security was good, with a small strongbox in a cupboard, and card security for the door. The bed was comfortable and warm (it was autumn, and the nights were chill). The room was clean, as you would expect of Holland. Surprisingly, the stair carpets were grubby. Fittings were well worn but servicable (or old fashioned and comfortable, depending on your view). Staff were welcoming and friendly, even when under pressure. They were of assistance to us in several ways, and took a personal interest in our requests. Internet was free, with one computer in the lobby. The tariff included breakfast. This was a buffet, and quite a good one at that. The dining room was comfortable, and the food was kept fresh and replenished as necessary. There were many restaurants nearby for other meals, and staff were quick to point out the most popular. The hotel is well located. From the hotel it was an easy walk to the Flower Market, the Reijksmuseum, van Gogh collection, many other museums and a lovely park. Waterlooplein was also in walking distance but we chose not to go to the flea market there. Instead we walked along the canals and explored some of the galleries. The best thing about the hotel was the staff. They were friendly and helpful at all times, and were efficient and obliging. The food was good, and the shower was tops. We found nothing bad or deficient - perhaps a guest lounge would be nice, possibly in the dining room. Some umbrellas to help travellers brave the rain would be great! Would I stay there again? You bet I would!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty old place”
Reviews.Author: neofytos
Reviews.Content: I left this place very quickly. Its DIRTY. There were many different lengths of hair on the sheets/pillows, stains all over the place on the sheets/pillow. Walls are tired and paint peeling off. Dust on many durfaces. Carpet grotty, dusty, the place is noisy. The only reason places like this get some ratings, is with all respect, some people have different standard expectations than others. In my student days some of my friends would think this place is a palace... but in their own shared student houses their bins were overflowing! Notice I didnt complain about anything fancy, as I dont look for that, just somewhere clean to sleep and wash. This isnt it. The bathroom had something growing in the shower. To top it off, I purchased WiFi and was told you can use it, stop and return later on without losing time... NO YOU CANT (money wasted). I cant comment on the breakfast as I left without staying a single night. However, I can tell you that all the dirty towels and bedsheets were chucked across the entrance to it, sounds hygenic to you?.... photos attached.

Reviews.Title: “Stay someplace else!!!”
Reviews.Author: trav6336
Reviews.Content: Limited service. Have to self help to get towels. They may or may not make up your room daily. Ice is not available nor are any other services. If you challenge the staff on any issue be prepred to be cussed out. The most heard statement is "that's not possible." Beware of the scam to force you to pay a 5% tip disguised as a city tax, even after all fees and taxes were pre-paid. No air conditioning and the noise will keep you from sleeping untill 3 or 4 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs and Bad service”
Reviews.Author: StockholmPingpong
Reviews.Content: The room - "LITTLE DID WE KNOW IT WAS BUG INFESTED" looked nice and clean when we arrived. Already after the first night I had small blemishes but didn't know why. After the second night I woke up early with more blemishes and itching and had bugs crawling all over the bed and a few on the other beds too. A few which we put in a cup and presented to the reception. We were moved to a different room but by then my whole family had blemishes and itches.The hotels response was "That it is nothing to be alarmed about, because it's normal when you have so many different people from so many different countries. Any person responsible as a manager was never to be found as we were promised. This from an establishment situated on PC Hoofdsraat, one of the most exclusive shopping streets in whole of Amsterdam. Cecilia and family

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: rrands
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very comfortable, liked the area and park entrance was just few steps away at end of the road. Clean restaurant and breakfast very good and substantial making a good start to each day. Easy to get a tram further into the city, or just walk leisurely through the fashion street or past the museums. Would definitely stay there again as it had everything we needed at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected & really lovely stay here - All rooms exactly as on the website....”
Reviews.Author: Carrie84
Reviews.Content: Wow! Just returned from the City Garden Hotel in Amsterdam! I loved it! I don't understand why there are negative reviews of this hotel - my only thoughts from the reviews and reviewer pictures are that it has probably had a major re-furb in the last 2 years. We were only looking for somewhere to put our head down but this was far more than we could of ever expected. We booked last minute through Booking.com and paid a total of Â£155 for two people for two nights for what is referred to as a small well equipped double / budget double - room 169. The Hotel: This hotel is a three star and I would say that was about right. It's clean and well furnished and looks pleasant from the outside. When we were staying there was a mixture of people staying. Not many British tourists, lots of spanish, german, italian tourists of all ages. I think my boyfriend and I were the youngest (mid twenties). There was also couples with young babies. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you are looking for a lively / noisy place to stay or if you intend on having parties in your room. If you are looking for a comfortable & quiet place to stay then read on..... The Location: We arrived in Amsterdam at 8am and couldn't check in until 2pm we decided to try our luck and get an early check in around 12pm unfortunately we couldn't but the reception staff were more than happy to look after our luggage for us. Walking down Hoofstraat to the hotel I was thrilled - it's located in what is referred to as the Museum and Fashion district - on the same street is Chanel, Louis Vuitton etc and it is in walking distance from various museums inc. Van Gogh Museum & the Heineken Brewery. A minute further down the street past the hotel is the entrance to the beautiful VondelPark which is where we spent a lazy few hours in the sun waiting for check in. At the top of the road are various trams that get you to many different places in the city. You could get a tram straight from Centraal Station to the hotel if you needed. The Room: When we got to the room we were thrilled. It was small yes but it was more than big enough for two and had a huge window facing onto the street. We had a double bed - (Fantastic -not two singles pushed together)!!!! - it had a very comfortable mattress and had plenty of pillows and covers- a wardrobe with hangers, a dresser table/desk with chair & mirror, a full length mirror, about 4 lamps, an en suite shower room with toilette & hairdryer, a TV with plenty of English channels subtitled in Dutch, phone, Kettle with tea (fruit & normal) & coffee, cups, saucers & spoons. The shower deserves a special mention it was a good size, super powerful with a never ending supply of scorching hot water - bliss - actually bigger and nicer than my own. There is also a hair dryer in the bathroom - a tube that comes out of the wall - it is more than adequate - I have really long thick hair & my hair was bone dry within 10 minutes. The maids also tidied and replaced towels every day. I was most impressed that the rooms looked exactly like they did on the hotel website. The Breakfast: The breakfast is included in the price and is served buffet style between 7am - 10am - regularly being replenished - it's great you can eat & drink as much as you want which is good if, like us, you're on a budget. We found 8am was a good time to eat - not too busy still plenty of food. Each day there was scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, various breads to toast and rolls, croissants, three types of ham, cheese, cereals, jams, yogurt and fruit salad (the tinned type). Along with orange juice and apple juice (both from concentrate) and various tea's and coffees. The staff at the hotel really can't do enough for you and are happy to make suggestions and book you onto excursions. The reception also seemed to be always manned - even when we arrived back in the early hours. I felt very safe & comfortable the whole time I was there. I couldn't recommend this place to you enough. Although the hotel is only a small part of a city break as you obviously want to be out and about the majority of the time it was really great to come back to such a comfortable room after a hard days sight seeing and also enjoy yourself safe in the knowledge that your belongings & money are safe in your room. When I return to Amsterdam I am hoping to stay here again and I will be pointing my friends in this direction.

Reviews.Title: “Travelled to this Hotel & would not stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: rebeccaeady
Reviews.Content: Ignore the rubbish of this hotel being 'dated' and 'small' I find this hotel is perfect for your short break to Amsterdam. Located on PC Hoofstraat, it is perfect for 1st class shopping & museums/sightseeing. The rooms are bang, up-to-date & I have never slept on such a comfy bed in my life. We even came back to the hotel room and had 2/3 hours sleep before we went out on the evening. I love the fact that if you are in your bedrooms you can watch a few english channels (Not that this is the be-all and end-all!) The shower/bathrooms were lovely, no problems, very clean! And all modernly decorated just like the bedroom. Breakfast is lovely, you can make cheese and ham toasties, lovely bread/croissants are on offer, cheese/hams, cereals, yoghurts and so forth. I can definitley deal with this, fill up and you won't have to spend too much at lunch times (where amsterdam is very expensive.) Evening meals around Leidesplein have amazing deals on meals! We foudn a gorgeous thai and it was to die for we paid about 12 euros each for a 2 course meal, which is exceptional, you will find other deals like this in and around this area. Dam Square is a nightmare to eat out at! Very pricey/expensive and very busy. To be honest it isn't all it's cracked upto be. I've been to this hotel twice now and would be very dissapointed if I didn't stay here again I think. Vindel Park is only a ten minute walk, the second time we came to this hotel we wandered in and out of the park as we had more time to explore as we'd been to Amsterdam before and done all the sightseeing bits and bats. Overall a perfect hotel! Would definitley recommend for anyone!

Reviews.Title: “You get MORE than you pay for!!!”
Reviews.Author: sarhols
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting too much from this hotel as we just wanted somewhere to lay our heads and not much else. we paid for a triple room (Â£125 each for 2 nights). while the decor is dated, it was very clean and adequate for our needs.It looks exactly like its picture on their website. The room overlooked the vondelpark and was so peaceful you could hear the birds singing - not bad for a City room on the weekend Scotland were playing the Netherlands!! The receptionist was really helpful - she arranged some tickets for the Anne Frank Huis. Breakfast is cereals, toast, scrambled eggs etc (not full English) where there is a friendly sign saying eat all you can - and we did!! There is a PC for free reasonable use of the guests, so make use of it by booking tickets for the musems on line to avoid the queues.The street the hotel is in, is really safe, enough that i felt fine walking there on my own at night. Because the end of the street is basically a gate to the park there is no through traffic. At the far end of the street are the fabulous designer stores of the city (Chanel, Gucci, Louis Vitton) and also has a few nice bistros so therefore giving it a really chic feel. At the end of the street you are nearly at the Leidsplein area which is much less touristy than central amsterdam but has every type food and drink you could want wether its cheap n cheerful or something a bit more special. The coffee shops are not quite as seedy as they can be in amsterdam central. The Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum are round the corner as is the House of Bols Museum which was a surprisinlg good find (google it!) There is both tram and canal hop-on-hop-off stops near the hotel which is great news so you can avoid the riduclous taxi fares (â‚¬20 to go less than a mile!!) . My one (small) niggle was the hairdryer - it was an old 70's style thing that barely blew any heat (not good for 3 girls sharing but not the end of the world either!) Overall, i had to keep reminding myself this was a 2 star hotel, because in my opinion it certainly deserves more!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: WhiteFone
Reviews.Content: I stayed six nights in early December in a single-bed room.. It's a wonderful hotel for the price. The room was small but very comfy. I booked it through Hotels.com for about $75 USD/night including taxes, which was much less than the advertised rates on City Garden Hotel's Web site. The Good - Staff is friendly. When I had a headache, one of them gave me aspirin. - Pretty good free breakfast buffet. Juices, scrambled eggs, ham, croissants, cereal and more. - Free umbrellas are available for your use. - Free use of only computer and Internet connection by the lobby. (Wireless Internet required buying card - I think about 10 euros for a few hours) - Convenient location - 15 minutes by Tram from Centraal Station. (Sorry I don't remember the tram number - Maybe the 5. To Van Baerlestraat.) 15 minutes walk from Leidesplein. 45 minutes walk to Damrak and Red Light District. 5 minute walk to trams in all directions. Right next to Vondelpark. PC Hooftstraat is a street filled with high-end shops. Near a bakery and cash machines for ING Barings and ABN Amro. - TV in your room. Decent channel lineup - English-language CNBC and CNN International included as well as Dutch-language stations. - Good shower pressure and hot water. - Decently heated room. Great view of Vondelpark - Non-smoking. - Free bag storage room. - Room was cleaned very well daily. Esp. if you leave a one euro a night tip. - Payphone is available by the lobby (but it eats through your phone card quickly if you're calling a mobile number). Better to use a mobile phone. Phone in room, but there are charges that are a bit less than the phone card. The Bad - None of these is a deal-breaker. - Small compared to an American hotel room. But that's Amsterdam. Not a big negative. - When you book through Hotels.com, the site doesn't collect the city tax of about 5 percent. (About $21USD in my case). You get informed at the desk that you owe the money, which kind of boils the blood pressure. The guy at the desk blamed Hotels.com. - During my six nights, people smoked in their rooms, which they're not supposed to do, setting off the extremely loud fire alarm about three times - once, I was awakened from a nap. - When you walk through the halls, you'll smell the marijuana, but that's common in Amsterdam. - Decently but not super soundproof. While walking through the halls, I heard the sounds of a couple having some intimate time. - If the guy at the desk in the middle of the night goes to the bathroom real quick or leaves the desk, he locks the automatic sliding door, so you can't get in or out for a few minutes..

Reviews.Title: “Good price/value, but don't some annoyances”
Reviews.Author: Brewsta
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in the hotel and got a great price for a superior double room. It had a great view of the Vondelpark. Room was nicely warm and had flatscreen TV. Hotel has great location for shopping and going to the Leidseplein or Museums. Nice breakfast with scrambled eggs. On the downside: As many have noted, the sheets have holes. There was a bit of a permanent odor in the bathroom. The keycards stopped working every couple of days. And the hallways have very creaky, noisy floorboards and you here everyone walk by your door early in the morning, plus their voices traveled under the gaps under the doors. Overall, I was satisfied, but could see how some might have a problem with the negative issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: travellin_fam4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with our two children as well as some friends who had children. Great location, very friendly helpful staff, and the room was more than we expected for the price. Rooms were clean, and the front desk was open 24 hours which was very nice. The hotel is on the end of a high end shopping street so it was a nice neighborhood, and very quiet. There was parking in front of the hotel, but we didn't use it because our navigation got us a bit lost! Our friends parked on the road though and their car was safe. The only minor complaint that I had was that in our room there was a gap under the door of about one inch that let a lot of noise in. Our friends did not have that problem in their room, though, so I don't know if there were other doors like ours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: irz
Reviews.Content: We were initially in a triple room with a very tiny bathroom, but after complaining we were immediately moved to a much better room. They should really do something about the sheets, since they all have holes. But the location was great and the price so good that one could overlook these things.

Reviews.Title: “What Garden?”
Reviews.Author: swabian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location at the bottom end of the PC Hoofstraat , so just a 10 minute walk to the Leidseplein and is in a quiet location. The room was clean although very warm - I had to put on the air conditioning...also - and I know Amsterdam hotel rooms are famously diminutive - the room was miniscule. Ok it was a single, but if rabbit hutches do it for you then this is just the place. I could easliy touch both sides of the room with at the same time with my arms outstretched. The upstairs rooms may be better. Having said this, the breakfast was good value and the staff polite and the shower room worked well - although no plug for some reason.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel!, avoid booking through venere.com or easytobook.com”
Reviews.Author: Real_Vacations
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, incredible good value for the money you pay. Professional staff, nice rooms, free internet, good and free breakfast. Terrific location, close to all attractions. Good tip: Avoid booking through venere.com or easytobook.com, they will make your vacation a nightmare and yor credit card a mess.

Reviews.Title: “A Mouse Lived in a Windmill..............”
Reviews.Author: HertsCommuter
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in Amsterdam but away from the immediate hustle and bustle of the centre of the city, and in this respect the hotel did not disappoint. We were checked in promptly and politely and our room was adequately sized (there were four of us in a family room). Multi channel TV, clean bathroom, tea and coffee etc. but a bit short of hanging/drying space for what was a very wet weekend. Breakfast was a buffet-style with plenty to choose from and unusually was included in the price, which was a major deciding factor for us. Staff were friendly and spoke excellent English. We had a couple of problems. Firstly, the room safe had been left open by the previous occupant in the 'locked' position, so we couldn't use it. Reception said that they would sort it out when the next person with the master key came on duty. This turned out to be 11.00pm, when Reception kindly telephoned the room, duly waking us up and offering to fix the safe. Needless to say we declined, thinking they'd do it in the morning. They didn't and we heard nothing more about it and we did without it for our stay. On our last evening we were watching TV when a mouse appeared in the middle of the floor then quickly disappeared. We could not find where it went and reported it to Reception, who apologised and noted the fact but could do nothing about the mouse itself. To be fair, they offered to move us to another room, but with it being our last night we said we'd put up with it. We heard it in the small hours behind the dresser, but could do nothing about it and didn't see it again before check out. However, the attraction seemed to be the sugar sachets from the tea/coffee facilities which the rodent had clearly got wise to. Looking at some of the older reviews on this site, it seems that rodent infestation is not new at this hotel and clearly the professionals need to be brought in. I was also a bit surprised that the windows were single-glazed, which meant that even low-level noise from outside could be heard, especially at night, and also meant that heat was going straight from the radiators out of the window. I don't want the mouse incident to overshadow what I thought was a great little hotel, but I guess if it had happened on the first of our three nights then my view might have been different.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great breakfast at City Garden Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Satchitian
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at the end of July. The room was clean and the staff friendly. The breakfast was excellent and varied. I was surprised it was included in the price. Overall excellent value. We would defineately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: weisertravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hotel City Garden for 3 nights and had a wonderful experience. As many others have said, the rooms are small but everything else was great (you aren't there to be in your room anyway!). The accommodations were clean and had everything we needed. The breakfast was excellent and had a great selection. The location was perfect as it is on a quiet little street next to a very nice shopping district and near the tram stop. We walked everywhere rather than taking the tram and the hotel was located close enough to everything to do so. We highly recommend Hotel City Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ChezaBrum
Reviews.Content: Stayed at City Garden Hotel Amsterdam for 4 nights in April 08. Found it easy to get to via tram from railway station - not walking distance especially if you have luggage. Booked this hotel as wanted to be in a quieter area away from the red light district but close enough to walk/tram to all attractions. Hotel is in a quiet, upmarket part of the city close to a lovely park. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms are comfortable and clean but not huge. The buffet breakfast was excellent with lots of choice and as much as you want fresh food. The hotel is very close to all the museums and a nice walk or tram ride to the centre for all other attractions. Great peaceful base for exploring Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “great wee hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonhill
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 4 night stay at this hotel. I went along with my wife and my bother and his wife. The staff were great and we stayed in excellent rooms. The Hotel is away from the bizz but is near to Vlondell Park which was a lovely walk to the main areas. The shops around this hotel and are of top quality. All manner of top fashion labels. My sister who lives in Amsterdam picked this hotel so this gives you more corroboration of its appeal. The breakfast room is very busy and indeed when we were there it was full. If you wanted you couldd no doubt pay througth the nose and go up market. I paid Â£58.00 per person per night for bed and breakfast. I am booking this hotel next year. ps The weather was hot and sunny.

Reviews.Title: “City Garden - most definately”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugDonegal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a fairly large group from work, for a weekend (2 nights) pre Christmas shopping etc. The trip was excellent and the hotel was very much part of that overall experience. Friendly staff at check-in and generally helpful at all times, excellent buffet breakfast. Free Internet point. Location was quiet, maybe a little bit out from Dam Square but easily accessible by tram and inexpensive. We found the people in Amsterdam to be very friendy and helpful from the tram drivers to shop owners and practically everyone we met. We were all amazed. It is a beaufiful city with canals, cyclists and beautiful buildings. On one day we visited the Cathedral, Van Gogh museum, Anne Frank museum, took a boat cruise and a visit to the Irish pub. We packed a lot into one day and still got to shop and visit the flower market the following morning before our flight back. Amsterdam has a more obvious and notorious tourist attraction but it has much, much more to offer the tourist. Very definately a city to return to in spring or early summer when it must surely be beautiful with all the "tulips from Amsterdam" in full bloom.

Reviews.Title: “small but a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonerica
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as was our first time to Amsterdam, it is quite a distance from the Main train station but is easily accessible by the trams and buses. Upon arrival our check in was speedy and very friendly, the room that we were given was a bit small but very comfortable and clean, the same for the bathroom that was also very small and very clean. The staff could not of been more friendly, they helped us in everything including finding a very late night snack. So thank you very much to the staff and we would definately go back to this hotel

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Vale of Glamorgan, South Wales, UK
Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cluky
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I returned home from Amsterdam yesterday. We booked the Superior Double room from Feb 3rd to Feb 6th we had room 407. The bed was really really comfortable and we had clean towels everyday. The ensuite shower room was also very nice and the shower was excellent. We always had hot water. The only bad point if we wanted to be picky was the windows. They were old and let a bit of a breeze through them but it didn't make any difference to us as the heating was working and we also had a portable heater. We thought the hotel was excellant value for money. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was excellent. It is a buffet style with cereal, fruit, toast, rolls, croissaints, brioche, ham, cheese, boiled and scrambbled eggs and various condiments and drinks. The food is kept well stocked up and the restaurant was very clean. It was served from 7:30am til 10:30am. It is located right next to Vondel park and is in the museum district. It is not right bang in the centre but still very close to everything. We used the number 2 or 5 tram fron Van Baarlastraat stop which is a 3 minute walk. To get to the hotel from the airport take the train to Central Station, then get a tram from Central Station either number 2 or 5. Get off at Van Baarlastraat and it is a few minutes walk from there. It helps to have a strret map. Tickets for train can be bought at the airport and trams tickets can be bought at Central Station. Would definatley use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: xsoph14x
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the city garden hotel in november 2007 for 6nights with my boyfriend. we found the hotel very nice, our room was smalller than it looked but was just right for what we wanted. hotel staff are friendly and the 24 hour desk made it easy to be out enjoying the amsterdam nights. breakfast was basic but nice and hotel was clean overall, sheets and towels changed daily. would recommend hotel to anyone, definately worth it if you can get a cheap deal, bit overpriced otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zellka
Reviews.Content: I would not have gone had I read these reviews however we found quite the opposite. Our room was a triple and was large, as large as a travelinn and well equipped too with tea and coffee making facilities. Our friends had a double which was small but functional. The breakfast was good and the staff friendly and helpful. Only slight negative is one of our party was bitten badly and was told by the pharmacist it was bedbugs, could have been picked up at this hotel but nobody else was affected. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: huwg
Reviews.Content: I would definately stay here again. The hotel is close to lots of attractions and bars/restaurants. Rooms are clean as are the bed cloths etc. No sign of the rat. I think they must have done it up lately. So if your on a budget you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “a rat in my room”
Reviews.Author: maltratado
Reviews.Content: There was a rat in my room. I woke up at 4 am and I am still waiting the compensation because I had to pay in advance and nobody there wants to give me my money back or even pay for the damages. Difficult to believe? I know. Check the photos

Reviews.Title: “Small room, nice breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: junglewig
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in May 2007 and found it to be average. On the plus side the free internet in the reception area was welcome, the breakfast was exstensive and tasty and the rooms had clearly been recently refurbished. On the minus side, the room was tiny, even though we were booked in a 'standard' room and not the 'small' room situated in the basement, I dread to think how small that one is! Also on the minus side, the hotel was still having renovations carried out (we were not told this when booking) and a workman started drilling at ten past eight one morning. The efficient reception staff were helpful with questions and there is a standard tourist information rack filled with details of things to do in Amsterdam. If you stay here it's possibly best to fork out a few extra euros and stay in one of the larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: NeoddSweven
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent location, great breakfast (included), fairly clean, quiet, comfortable beds, nice towels and sheets, seems like it was recently remodeled. Staff spoke english very well, and were quite helpful. No A/C, but a fan in our room (I've never seen that in a European hotel, but was thrilled to not have to leave the window open in the late spring when it's so bright outside and my kids go to sleep early) Cons: A little pricey (but it is Amsterdam), and the "cheap hotels" website didn't quite book it right--maybe just go right to the hotel's website to make sure you get the fare right. We also had a mouse in our room (but hung up our food after the 1st night and only a few snacks were ruined). Not a big deal. We'd stay there again, since the price was average, the location excellent and the breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: stanlvlxc
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about staying at this hotel after reading the reviews listed here. Fortunately, I was pleasantly surprised that most of them were not true. The room was clean and looked as if it had recently been renovated. The breakfast was quite varied and always had lots of food to fill you up in the morning. The bathroom looked newly renovated and was nice. The rooms included your own electronic safe. The location was a big plus, steps away from Vondelpark, Van Gough Museum, Rijksmuseum and the trams to Centrum. It is also located on a very posh shopping street featuring Hugo Boss, Gucci etc. The only downside was the room and bathroom were a little small, but that is to be expected in European hotels, but it was by no means a cupboard. I would consider staying there again if in Amsterdam in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, comfortable, friendly. Cheers!”
Reviews.Author: System_Star
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried after booking this hotel to see the candid traveller photos. I am not bothered too much about the rooms, but I knew my friends would be. When we arrived at the hotel the reception staff were very friendly and remained so throughout our whole stay. We had a laugh with them when calling up taxi's etc. You can tell that the hotel has obviously just been renovated as the 2 rooms that we booked had all new carpets, bathroom, bed linen, TV etc. The bathrooms were tiny, I am not going to lie, but it was fine for me to have a shower in & brush my teeth in the morning. Our rooms weren't together, but I don't think we put this down as a request, so I can't really comment. The breakfast was your standard continental effort, but it was really nice and we were kept topped up! We were right beside the Vondelpark and only a short walk from one of the main musuems. Also the tram system was nearby and that can get you ANYWHERE and is very reliable. I never usually review, but I felt that this hotel got a bad reputation on here and after the staff being so nice to us and really enjoying our stay I had to put my word in ;)

Reviews.Title: “Small Doubles are Cupboards”
Reviews.Author: milligan1959
Reviews.Content: To describe a 'small double' room as compact is an understatement. We arrived quite late in the evening it was -2 degrees outdoors. We were given a key for a room on the third floor. The room was so small that the two of us could not stand up at the same time. The bathroom although it looked clean smelled of drains. The double bed filled the whole area between the walls and was pushed up against a cold radiator and a metal framed window which ran ceiling to floor, the window was partially open and would not close properly. You could not walk around the bed, and the person at the right hand side had to endure the cold from the window. At 2.00am after hours of trying to get the radiator to work, frostbite set in an we had to contact reception with a view to either getting the radiator to work and the window to shut, or change rooms. The staff were very helpful and having given up on the radiator moved us to a room in the basement. This room was marginally bigger, though the bed was in exactly the same place pushed against old badly fitting windows, the bathroom did not smell quite so bad, and the heating worked with a choice of red hot or cold. This room was located right underneath the 24 hours reception and bar which resulted in it being quite noisy and a lot of furniture moving went on around 3.30 - 4.00am every morning. The buffet breakfast was adequate, the problem was that the three ladies responsible for topping things up etc were reluctant to clear away the tables, thus on busy mornings it was difficult to find a clean one, we had to clear and clean our own. The hotel is situated in an ideal location for walking into the city centre, the staff on the whole were welcoming and friendly, the problem is the building which is need of a complete makeover. I do not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly, affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: dondenton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple nights at the start of our trip. The staff was very friendly, and the accomodations were quite good for the low price, and the location is good. One small warning is that there are no safes in your room, and the safe at the front desk seemed to only be big enough for passports and cash.

Reviews.Title: “Something out of a horror movie”
Reviews.Author: Dinahmac
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this establishment early evening after a 12 hour flight from Hong Kong- our travel agent had booked it and we had prepaid NZ$680.00 for a two night stay. The receptionist informed us, on arrival, that our room was on the third floor and the lift was broken - unfortunately no porter either!! This would have meant carrying our substantial baggage up 3 flights of stairs - not really an option - so we asked if they had anything on the ground floor - just one room she said. Once we were inside with our baggage there was actually no room to move, two single beds, a very small bathroom. After a series of negatives, lack of phone or any communication we started to feel decidedly uncomfortable so asked for a taxi to another hotel. All in all a dreadful experience and would not wish anyone to have the same.

Reviews.Title: “what can i say”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our beds had lice in them. Were bitten all night. Had to get a lice cure when we got homr.

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The address was on one of the most chic in Amsterdam, and the description published by the hotel boasted of many amenities. However, when my taxi arrived in the late evening, I realized immediately that I was going to be extremely disappointed. The carpet was frayed, the door sqeaked, and the receptionist was rude and untidy. If it was not for the time of evening, I would have left immediately. However, I did check in to a very small room with two uncomfortable beds. The bedspread had several cigarette burns, the towels were paper thin and the bed was lumpy. My goal was to endure the night and get out the first thing in the morning. I discovered that AMS had another hotel about four blocks down toward the Concertgebouw. I inspected a room there and was pleased. It was twenty euros more but certainly worth it. I would not recommend anyone staying in the AMS Holland as it is a dismal place to spend sixty nine euros. I felt dirty staying there even if it is just down the street from some of the most refined shops in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I'd checked TripAdvisor first...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wish I'd checked here first before allowing a travel agent to book me into this dive. The location may be good, but the only good thing about the hotel itself is the door out of it. Our room was downstairs at basement level, and was dark, dingy and dirty. This is without contest the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. We did not feel safe here, and would not recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family found this hotel to be perfect for our needs; certainly the decor is outdated and the carpets worn, but the room was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, particularly at the lobby bar and the location (within walking distance of Vondelpark, Museumplein and Leidseplein) was ideal. The negative reviews this hotel has received suggest people who spend a lot more time in their hotel rooms when they travel than we do. We'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “1 star is even a bit generous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs some major remodeling. Giving it 3 stars is way too much. 1 star is pushing it. The location is good and the staff are very friendly, however the rooms need some serious remodeling...

Reviews.Title: “AMS Holland Hotel, in a word "DISCUSTING"!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As many of the other guests I talked to when I was there, we were discusted with the rooms. Our room had torn sheets, holes in the walls,rust around the sink and shower plugs, fur growing on the ceiling of the bathroom, filthy carpets and Rentokill mouse traps around the skirting boards. One couple we talked to had been bitten all night and couldn't sleep. We were very dissapointed and even rang our travel agent and tried to changed hotel but everything was fully booked, It was a Valentines holiday I booked and we had seperate beds, when I asked at reception if they would swap our rooms for a double they wasn't interested. I am going to complain in writing to my Travel Agent and accompany this with Photographs.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: VALENTINES WEEKEND. Booked through Bridge Travel,found the room (twin) very cramped,very musty(damp) smelling. The Shower/Bathroom had mold all over the the ceiling and side walls,the wardrobe had pieces missing from it and the sink unit was leaning to one side.The Bedspreads had cigarette burns in them and the carpets where badly stained.There where Mouse Bait Traps on floor 2 where I counted 5 down one corridor.When I asked to be moved to another room I was told it was not possible as every room was full.If you are paying for Breakfast do not expect anything much better.For a Two**(star) Hotel it felt more like a Bedsit,very over rated I would give it -**(star).

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel City Garden Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: P.C. Hooftstraat 162, Amsterdam 1071 CH, The Netherlands
